result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter R Ripp

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
To be set for plea & sentencing
Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Offer extended; another status conference to be set

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle with any alcohol in their system. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall not possess any firearms except while participating in a sanctioned firearm practice, event or competition which is supervised by the establishment hosting that event. Defendant is not to possess any firearms outside that caveat.

Reporter:  Patrick Weishan
 Defendant in court with Attorney Aaron L. Abram (both by zoom).  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arguments heard; Parties stipulate and court orders to change "Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]" to "Defn shall not possess any firearms except while participating in a sanctioned firearm practice, event or competition which is supervised by the establishment hosting that event.  Defn is not to possess any firearms outside that caveat"; all other conditions remain the same
Bail/bond hearing on July 13, 2022 at 09:45 am.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Pre-trial conference on August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle with any alcohol in their system. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Trial Judge - Br 7

09:00 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Aaron L. Abram.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
